name: incompressible
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be pressed into a smaller space: Air is extremely compressible, while water is almost incompressible. The risk of explosion is greatly reduced by the use of incompressible fluids as the pressurizing medium.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is no change in volume, that is, the material is incompressible.The liquid can be assumed to be incompressible.Mineral particles cannot be compacted, nor can water, as it is solid mass and is incompressible.Consider an elastic, incompressible material filling a three-dimensional space.
